multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been having a red, itchy rash on my eyebrows and around my nose for about eight months, and I also have dandruff on my scalp.
Have you tried any treatments or medications for your symptoms?
Yes, I've tried using moisturizers on the rash areas, but the flakiness keeps returning a few days later.
Do symptoms improve when you use any specific products or medications, even temporarily?
Yes, the flakiness improves temporarily when I use moisturizers.
Do you have any known allergies?
No, I don't have any known allergies.
Have you experienced similar skin issues in the past?
No, I have not experienced similar skin issues in the past.
Does anyone in your family have similar symptoms or a history of skin conditions?
I've provided all the information I have, and there's no mention of family history related to similar symptoms or skin conditions in the details I know.
Final Diagnosis: Seborrheic dermatitis
